title: Buoyant Force - mass of metal  sphere

content.description: A small sphere with volume <math alttext="V equals, 3.7 times 10 raised to the negative 4 power, cubic meters" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math> is released from rest at the surface of a large pool of water which is <math alttext="3.0 meters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>3.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> </math> deep. The density of water is <math alttext="rho sub water equals 1,000 kilograms per cubic meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>water</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>. The sphere reaches the bottom of the pool in \(1.5\text{ s}\). Drag force from the water is negligible.
content.question: What is the approximate mass of the sphere?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
